snippet: If Julia Child had ever ventured into Chinese cooking, she may have made something like this Franco-Chinese salad, with grilled chicken breast and a zesty vinaigrette.
abstract: David Tanis City Kitchen column notes that although Julia Child was a devoted Francophile she also loved Chinese food; offers a recipe for a Franco-Chinese grilled sesame chicken and eggplant salad he would serve her if she were coming to lunch today.
lead_paragraph: If Julia Child had ever ventured into Chinese cooking, she may have made something like this Franco-Chinese salad, with grilled chicken breast and a zesty vinaigrette.

headline.seo: No Butter, But Salad to Honor Julia Child - City Kitchen
headline.main: The French Chef’s Detour to China
headline.print_headline: The French Chef’s Detour To China
